oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Dual metal and Lewis base catalysis approach for asymmetric synthesis of dihydroquinolines and the alpha-arylation of aldehydes via N-acyliminium ions
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: VOLLA, CMR
FAVA, E
ATODIRESEI, I
RUEPING, M
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: REISSERT-TYPE REACTION
MANNICH REACTION
SUBSTITUTED QUINOLINES
BIFUNCTIONAL CATALYST
IMINIUM ACTIVATION
RECENT PROGRESS
UNIFYING METAL
NMDA RECEPTOR
ORGANOCATALYSIS
ACID
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A dual catalytic system consisting of indium triflate and a chiral imidazolidinone catalyzes the asymmetric addition of aldehydes to N-acyl quinoliniums furnishing optically active dihydroquinolines in good yields and excellent selectivities. The products were further functionalized into optically active tetrahydroquinolines, quinolines and 6-oxa-2-aza-bicyclo[3.3.1] nonanes.
